timeline.body:
What if the user made mistake and then unsets `PriceEntered_Override`, or changes it to be == `PriceEntered`?

Suggestion/Idea: keep the two values in IC, but don't use them in InvoiceCandidateRecordHelper, if `!icRecord.getPriceEntered().equals( icRecord.getPriceEntered_Override() )`
timeline.bodyText:
What if the user made mistake and then unsets PriceEntered_Override, or changes it to be == PriceEntered?
Suggestion/Idea: keep the two values in IC, but don't use them in InvoiceCandidateRecordHelper, if !icRecord.getPriceEntered().equals( icRecord.getPriceEntered_Override() )
timeline.bodyHTML:
What if the user made mistake and then unsets PriceEntered_Override, or changes it to be == PriceEntered?

Suggestion/Idea: keep the two values in IC, but don't use them in InvoiceCandidateRecordHelper, if !icRecord.getPriceEntered().equals( icRecord.getPriceEntered_Override() )
timeline.author: metas-ts

+package de.metas.contracts.commission.commissioninstance.interceptor;
+
+import lombok.NonNull;
+import org.adempiere.ad.modelvalidator.annotations.Interceptor;
+import org.adempiere.ad.modelvalidator.annotations.ModelChange;
+import org.compiere.model.I_C_OrderLine;
+import org.compiere.model.ModelValidator;
+import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;
+
+@Interceptor(I_C_OrderLine.class)
+@Component
+public class C_OrderLine
+{
+	/**
+	 *  Reset {@link I_C_OrderLine.COLUMNNAME_Base_Commission_Points_Per_Price_UOM} and {@link I_C_OrderLine.COLUMNNAME_Traded_Commission_Percent}
+	 *  in case the price computed by the price engine was overridden by the user in UI, so the commission points will be calculated based on the
+	 *  {@link I_C_OrderLine.COLUMNNAME_PriceActual}.
+	 *
+	 * @param icRecord Invoice Candidate record
+	 */
+	@ModelChange(timings = { ModelValidator.TYPE_BEFORE_NEW, ModelValidator.TYPE_BEFORE_CHANGE },
+				 ifColumnsChanged = {I_C_OrderLine.COLUMNNAME_PriceEntered, I_C_OrderLine.COLUMNNAME_PriceStd})
+	public void resetComputedCommissionPoints(@NonNull final I_C_OrderLine icRecord)

timeline.bodyHTML:
making it explicit like this is good, but please add more info, so the errormessage is as actionable as possilbe.
suggestion:

Suggested change
Check.assume(configs.size() <= 1, "There is only one active commission contract for a sales rep at a certain time!");
if (configs.size() > 0)
{
throw new AdempiereException("Expecting only one active commissionConfig for a sales rep at a certain time!")
.appendParametersToMessage()
.setParameter("salesRepBPartnerId", contractRequest.getSalesRepBPartnerId())
.setParameter("contractRequest", contractRequest)
.setParameter("hierarchy", hierarchy)
.setParameter("commissionConfigs", configs);
}

timeline.body:
since you don't use the setters, i suggest that you use lombok's `@Value` instead
(*if* it made sense to use `@Data`, then you should make the classe's fields `private`. but with  `@Value`, that's already done for you)
timeline.bodyText:
since you don't use the setters, i suggest that you use lombok's @Value instead
(if it made sense to use @Data, then you should make the classe's fields private. but with  @Value, that's already done for you)
timeline.bodyHTML:
since you don't use the setters, i suggest that you use lombok's @Value instead
(if it made sense to use @Data, then you should make the classe's fields private. but with @Value, that's already done for you)

timeline.body:
As of very recently we register a dedicated loggable while the pricing engine runs.
So there is something to gain by
```suggestion
			Loggables.withLogger(logger, Level.DEBUG).addLog("Not applying due to missing calculated price!");
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
As of very recently we register a dedicated loggable while the pricing engine runs.
So there is something to gain by

Suggested change
logger.debug("Not applying due to missing calculated price!");
Loggables.withLogger(logger, Level.DEBUG).addLog("Not applying due to missing calculated price!");
timeline.author: metas-ts

timeline.body:
when rewriting the price, please do a 
```java
Loggables.withLogger(logger, Level.DEBUG).addLog(...);
```
I think it makes sense to allso do this when returning without having done anything (further up in htis method).
Might spare us a lot of head-scratching later, when a customer asks us why a particular price was not the way she expected.

timeline.body:
i checked `de.metas.cache.CCache.CCache(String, String, Set<String>, Integer, Integer, CacheMapType, CachingKeysMapper<K>, CacheRemovalListener<K, V>, CacheAdditionListener<K, V>)`..
I think this *will* work, but to reduce FUD, please do
```suggestion
			.tableName(I_C_Customer_Trade_Margin.Table_Name)
```
..and use `additionalTableNameToResetFor` only if there are further names
timeline.bodyText:
i checked de.metas.cache.CCache.CCache(String, String, Set<String>, Integer, Integer, CacheMapType, CachingKeysMapper<K>, CacheRemovalListener<K, V>, CacheAdditionListener<K, V>)..
I think this will work, but to reduce FUD, please do
  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            			.additionalTableNameToResetFor(I_C_Customer_Trade_Margin.Table_Name)
          
          
            
            			.tableName(I_C_Customer_Trade_Margin.Table_Name)
          
      
    
    
  

..and use additionalTableNameToResetFor only if there are further names
timeline.bodyHTML:
i checked de.metas.cache.CCache.CCache(String, String, Set<String>, Integer, Integer, CacheMapType, CachingKeysMapper<K>, CacheRemovalListener<K, V>, CacheAdditionListener<K, V>)..

timeline.message:
Price Calculation as % of Margin - applied suggested changes
refs: https://github.com/metasfresh/metasfresh/issues/6045

timeline.body:
```suggestion
		if ( orderLine.getPriceEntered().compareTo( orderLine.getPriceStd() ) == 0)
```
..we don't want things to happen, just because `1.equals(1.0)` is `false`
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
if ( orderLine.getPriceEntered().equals( orderLine.getPriceStd() ) )
if ( orderLine.getPriceEntered().compareTo( orderLine.getPriceStd() ) == 0)

..we don't want things to happen, just because 1.equals(1.0) is false
timeline.author: metas-ts
